title: 4 Doctor-Approved Snacks for Gut & Liver Health You NEED to Try
Do not file for divorce unless you are sure about this
description:
As a family law practitioner, I often consult a lot of husbands and wives who face matrimonial issues. A frequent scenario I encounter is when a spouse feels slightly neglected and subconsciously believes that sending a legal notice or filing for divorce will make their partner realize their importance, apologize, and restore the love and attention they desire.

 

I explain to my clients that when drafting a legal notice or divorce case, a lawyer will typically advise including numerous exaggerated allegations beyond the actual events. This approach is taken to ensure that if a full-fledged divorce is pursued, the case is as legally robust as possible.

 

While I can assure you that such a draft would outline all legally valid grounds for divorce however, the original intent behind sending a legal notice or filing a divorce petition gets defeated. The reality is that after reading these exaggerated allegations, any remaining chance for reconciliation is likely to be lost. Your spouse will probably consult another lawyer to respond to such a legal notice or divorce petition who will then escalate the situation by suggesting even more severe counter-allegations.

 

Therefore, if you are not entirely certain about 100% separation, it is advisable not to send a legal notice or file any case against your spouse.

 

#law #husband #wives #divorce #lawyer #familylaw #legalnotice 

I am a Delhi based lawyer.

You can send me your stories at amish.aggarwala@gmail.com
https://wa.me/+919958177114

I post regularly on:
Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC_39GbojQPbzFX5xqB0Gu2g

title: Oprah Winfrey-Learn How To Become A Smart Women With 7 Principles |Oprah Winfrey Motivational Speech
description:
Subscribe our youtube channel for unlock your inspiration;
https://youtube.com/@MIInspirationLegacy?si=60b1I9aYkeuz8Lea

#motivation #inspiration #oprahwinfrey #challengeyourself #consistency #energy #unlockyourpotential 

Why we listen this speech..?
We listen to this speech because it reminds us of the importance of celebrating ourselves. In a world where we are often taught to downplay our achievements, this message encourages us to embrace our worth and recognize the power in our journeys. 

It empowers us to trust our instincts, take pride in every step weve taken, and not wait for external validation. It encourages us to love ourselves, honor our progress, and appreciate the growth weve experienced. 

The speech speaks to women who are ready to own their power, stop shrinking to fit others expectations, and celebrate who they areright now, just as they are. 

By celebrating ourselves, we inspire others to do the same. When we stand in our truth, we create a ripple effect of confidence, love, and empowerment. 

We listen because its a call to action to live boldly, love ourselves deeply, and celebrate our essence every day! 

Timestamps...
0:00  1:30: Opening remarks: Setting the tone with the importance of self-celebration. 
1:31  4:00: "Stop Waiting for Permission": Empowering women to take ownership of their worth. 
4:01  7:30: "Recognize Your Wins, Big and Small": Celebrating every step, no matter how small. 
7:31  10:00: "Celebrate the Woman Youve Become": Reflecting on past growth and challenges. 
10:01  13:00: "Create Your Own Celebration Rituals": Practical ways to honor yourself daily. 
13:01  16:00: "Dont Downplay Your Greatness": Embracing your power and shining unapologetically. 
16:01  19:30: "Celebrate the Process, Not Just the Outcome": Finding joy in the journey, not just the destination. 
19:31  22:00: "Your Celebration Inspires Others": How self-love creates a ripple effect. 
22:01  25:00: Personal anecdotes and real-life examples of celebration. 
25:01  28:00: Call to action: Encouraging everyone to live boldly and celebrate themselves. 
28:01  30:57: Closing: You are the occasioncelebrate today, tomorrow, and always! 

Description...
This speech is a powerful call to celebrate yourselfto honor your journey, your growth, and your worth every single day.  In a world that often teaches us to downplay our achievements or wait for external recognition, this speech encourages us to break free from those limits. Its a reminder that you are worthy of celebration right now, just as you are, with all your uniqueness, flaws, and strengths. 

Its about embracing who you are, acknowledging the victories big and small, and realizing that every step forward is worth recognizing.  Whether its the courage to try something new or simply showing up for yourself, each moment matters.  The speech inspires us to trust our instincts, take pride in how far weve come, and not wait for perfection to celebrate our accomplishments. 

By celebrating yourself, you not only honor your own journey but also inspire others to do the same.  Its a ripple effect of self-love, confidence, and empowerment, where women uplift each other and stand in their power. 

This speech is a reminder that you are enough. You are worthy of love, of recognition, and of living in the fullness of your essence.  So, go aheadcelebrate yourself! 

#YouAreAmazing, #CelebrateYourWorth, #LiveYourBestLife, #EmbraceYourLight, #BeYourOwnCheerleader, #BoldAndBeautiful, #ConfidenceIsPower, #CelebrateYourGrowth, #KeepShiningBright, #EmpowerAndElevate, #LivingInGratitude, #HonorYourselfFirst, #SelfLoveIsRevolutionary, #RiseAbove, #ConfidenceOverComfort, #CelebrateEveryStep, #StrengthInSelfLove, #LoveYourselfMore, #ElevateYourself, #CourageToCelebrate, #CreateYourOwnPath,

title: City Canvas: Art With Elders Exhibition at City Hall
description:
The San Francisco Arts Commission (SFAC) Galleries is pleased to partner with Art With Elders to present The Power of Creativity and Community, an exhibition that showcases over 90 original paintings and drawings made by seniors participating in the Art With Elders program from forty programming sites and community partners located throughout San Francisco and the Bay Area.

Art With Elders was founded in 1991 and has brought creativity and connection to 12,000 older adults in 75 senior communities across the Bay Area through free or low-cost art classes. Weekly art classes are at the core of AWE work, providing the opportunity to elder to flex latent artistic talents and to connect with other members of the community. AWE also organizes exhibitions that take place all around the Bay Area, to showcase the extraordinary work by these elder artists.  
Monday - Friday, 8 a.m. - 6 p.m.
City Hall, North Light Court & Ground Floor

title: Take a look inside this spooky museum, if you dare
description:
In Bergen, Alberta, two brothers have created The Museum of Fear and Wonder.

»Subscribe to CBC Arts to watch more videos: http://bit.ly/CBCArtsSubscribe

There's a doll in The Museum of Fear and Wonder that, depending on your leaning, could be read as charming or chill-inducing. You can make a decision on your own about whether the doll, in itself, is frightful, but it's a good example of how the stories we build around objects have everything to do with how we see them.

These sorts of complicated mysterious objects make up the collection of The Museum, founded by brothers Brendan Griebel and Jude Griebel. There's already a tradition of museums that house curiosities, but the focus of this one is particularly on objects that have a psychological or narrative association. So, inside the re-purposed army barracks near Bergen, Alberta, you can find things like the aforementioned doll, a chess set made by a death row prisoner in the period before his execution, dollhouses, anatomical models, and plenty of other objects that have had emotional relationships with their owners or makers.

In the above video, the brothers take you inside  if you dare.

Find us at http://bit.ly/CBCArtsWeb
CBC Arts on Facebook: http://bit.ly/CBCArtsFacebook
CBC Arts on Twitter: http://bit.ly/CBCArtsTwitter
CBC Arts on Instagram: http://bit.ly/CBCArtsInstagram

About: CBC Arts is your destination for extraordinary Canadian arts. Whether you're a culture vulture, a working artist, an avid crafter, a compulsive doodler or just a dabbler in the arts, there's something for you here.

Take a look inside this spooky museum, if you dare

title: AWE-INSPIRING ARCHITECTURE: National Gallery Singapore, Civic District, Singapore
description:
Enjoy the sights and sounds as I walk around the National Gallery Singapore with beautiful views of the Singapore Central Business District (CBD) skyline. The Gallery looked majestic and stunning with warm lights in the night -- a real sight to behold. 

There's more to see in my walk as I continue around the institutions of arts around this area.

More about National Gallery Singapore (from Visit Singapore):

Fittingly located in the heart of the Civic District, the Gallery is housed in the City Hall and the former Supreme Courttwo iconic buildings that have played a monumental role in Singapore's history. Utmost care was taken to ensure that preservation guidelines for these two national monuments were being upheld even as they were being remodelled into a state-of-the-art museum for the public.

Dedicated to curating a collection that will provide insights into the unique art, heritage and history in the region, the Gallery is a must-visit destination in Singapore. At 64,000 square metres, it is the largest visual arts venue in Singapore and one of the largest in the region.

title: How Do You Overcome Kitchen Fear To Cook Easy Meals? - Teenager Guide to Life
description:
How Do You Overcome Kitchen Fear To Cook Easy Meals? Are you feeling nervous about cooking in the kitchen? In this helpful video, well share simple steps to help you overcome kitchen fear and start making easy, delicious meals. Well cover how to choose beginner-friendly recipes that build your confidence and break down the cooking process into manageable parts. Youll learn the importance of preparing all your ingredients and tools before you start, making cooking less stressful and more enjoyable. Well also discuss essential safety tips to keep you safe while cooking, including proper hygiene and how to handle kitchen appliances safely. Dont worry about mistakes  everyone makes them! Well show you how to learn from them and improve with each attempt. Plus, discover how to trust your senses to know when food is ready and what to do if your meal doesnt turn out perfect. Having a backup plan can help you stay relaxed and enjoy the process. Remember, cooking is about progress and having fun, not perfection. Developing your skills in the kitchen will help you become more independent and confident in taking care of yourself. Start small, be patient, and enjoy learning new cooking skills at your own pace.

title: How to stay calm under pressure - Noa Kageyama and Pen-Pen Chen
description:
Download a free audiobook version of "The Boys on the Boat" and support TED-Ed's nonprofit mission: https://adbl.co/2Lf9Pa2

Check out our full book recommendation: http://bit.ly/2IDVLsY

View full lesson: https://ed.ted.com/lessons/how-to-avoid-choking-under-pressure-noa-kageyama-and-pen-pen-chen

Your favorite athlete closes in for a win; the crowd holds its breath, and at the crucial moment ... she misses the shot. That competitor just experienced the phenomenon known as choking, where despite months, even years, of practice, a person fails right when it matters most. Why does this happen, and what can we do to avoid it? Noa Kageyama and Pen-Pen Chen explain why we choke under pressure.

Lesson by Noa Kageyama and Pen-Pen Chen, animation by Olesya Shchukina.

Thank you so much to our patrons for your support! Without you this video would not be possible! Mehmet Sencer KARADAYI, Christian Kurch, SungGyeong Bae, Luis Felipe Ruiz Langenscheidt, Joe Huang, Rohan Gupta, Senjo Limbu, Martin Lau, Robson Martinho, Jason Garcia, Cailin Ramsey, Aaron Henson, John Saveland, Nicolle Fieldsend-Roxborough, Venkat Venkatakrishnan, Sandy Nasser, CG Nobles, QIUJING L BU, Yoga Trapeze Wanderlust, Jaron Blackburn, Alejandro Cachoua, Thomas Mungavan, Elena Crescia, Edla Paniguel, Sarah Lundegaard, Anna-Pitschna Kunz, Tim Armstrong, Erika Blanquez, Ricki Daniel Marbun, zjweele13, Judith Benavides, Ross Henriques, Ken, Caitlin de Falco, Scheherazade Kelii, Errys, James Bruening, Michael Braun-Boghos, Ricardo Diaz, Kack-Kyun Kim, Artem Minyaylov, Alexandrina Danifeld, Danny Romard, Yujing Jiang, Stina Boberg, Mariana Ortega, Anthony Wiggins, Hoai Nam Tran, Joe Sims, and David Petrovič.

title: The Only Cure for Resentment
description: Resentment will Kill you. Lots of research shows it causes ulcers and physical problems. There is only one cure for resentment: Forgiveness. Resentment is not Righteous Indignation, which is moral outrage at injustice. Resentment comes from feeling demeaned and believing your worth has been lessened. So the real problem with resentment is doubts in your own mind about your worth, not the other person out there. Resentment is a problem you have with yourself.

title: Have you seen Instow beach in North Devon?.
description:
I took this video about  years before my dear Mum passed away. It's at Instow beach, Barnstaple, Devon. Visiting my Mum in 2022.

Hi! I'm  Stephie, Gen X 'er, was a British Expat in the USA for 18 years, became a US citizen and then later returned to the UK, after being widowed in 2022 and now planning on making a U turn back to my new homeland. In my videos, youll find me outside as much as possible, in beautiful landscapes, reflecting on lifes challenges as I've moved across the pond and back. If youre interested in hearing more about Expat life, mistakes made, the emotional journey, personal reflections, and the ups and downs of major life transitions past 50,  jump in with me to share in my real life experiences and expat living abroad and now as a Reverse Expat with reverse culture shock (in the country where I grew up!).

I offer a share of life over 50 and maybe solutions for problems that many of us face, like job insecurities. mental and physical health priorities, Midlife reinvention, downsizing and Nostalgia & throwbacks
uploader: Across the pond and back with Stephie

title: 7 Reasons People Regret Their Decision To Retire in France | Cons and Cost of Living.
description:

Dozens of people who moved to retire in France told me the cons and their biggest regrets.

From the cost of living to the characteristics of cities like Bordeaux, Toulouse, Lyon, Marseille, and, of course, Paris, they explained to me why retiring in France might sound great at first, but it also has obstacles that must be considered.

If you have ever considered moving to France for retirement, this is the video you should watch FIRST.

 *** ABOUT THE CHANNEL ***
From ten years living as an expatriate in the Middle East, South America, and Eastern Europe, to facts from reliable sources. Straightforward, no-nonsense guides for every expat.

Some of the links posted and mentioned may be affiliate links, meaning that the author will have a commission for any transaction.

 TOPICS IN THIS VIDEO 
americans retiring in france, best places to retire in france, cons of living in france, cons of living in paris, cost of living in marseille, cost to retire in france, how to retire in france, life in bordeaux france, living in bordeaux france, living in marseille france, moving to bordeaux france, pros and cons of living in france, retire in bordeaux france, retire in lyon, retire in toulouse, retire to france, retired in france, retiring in france, retiring in france from us, retiring in southern france, toulouse expat, whats it like living in france, where to retire in france

 EXCERPT 
Have you ever thought about moving to France
but worried about hidden challenges?
Those certain things nobody tells you,
either because they are afraid
or ashamed,
or because it is not politically correct?
Here is the thing: you should be concerned, you really should.
There is a big chance you will be disappointed.
Unless youre a Brit moving to Bordeaux -
Because most Brits somehow manage to live happily in that part of France
Today you will discover the main reasons foreigners who move to retire in France
regret their choice.
We will also understand the curious case of success between Bordeaux and the Brits.
What is their secret?
Ive gathered the stories of dozens of foreigners who lived in France for years,
and uncovered the 7 common regrets they never expected.
What you are about to see is eye-opening.
Not only for those planning to move to France, but for many European countries.
The first 4 causes for regrets are small things that are easy for you to avoid - they just require some adaptations.
The last 3, however, are more dangerous, and often people are afraid to talk about them.
And the first regret is
In certain areas, it will be very difficult for you to socialize.
The most important thing here is to NOT compare the French way of socialization to the American way.
In the US, you can easily interact with friendly employees at the local Wal-Mart and exchange fishing stories.
In France, that is way more difficult.
For example, if you ask Americans about their holidays, they might say, "Oh, it was amazing! It was wonderful!"

title: Pet snake loves scratches
description:
A snake displays astonishingly feline behavior. 

The footage shows the reptile slithering throughout the house, only to be delighted by its owner's gentle back scratch. The reptile astonishingly contorts the region being scratched, seemingly reveling in the affectionate gesture.

The video was filmed by @children.of.loki  on July 13, 2023, in Texas, US.
